title: Augmented Reality-Based Mobile Learning Program for Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Context-based mathematical problem-solving learning utilizing augmented reality (AR) technology in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to visualize and analyze complex mathematical problems in 3D space through AR-based simulations.

Learners collaborate with three peers using digital tools (Google Jamboard, Miro) over two weeks to solve four math problems in a mobile microlearning environment, and submit communication records meeting four or more of five peer review checklist items per task.

Learners apply three or more mathematical thinking skills (spatial reasoning, pattern recognition, algorithm design) to solve geometric optimization problems in augmented reality scenarios, and submit project outcomes achieving an average of 4+ points (5-point scale) via peer/instructor evaluations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
